page.title: 11HAGLEY POLICE STATION
page.content: There has been a police station in Hagley since{December 1839,}when it came under the Sub-Division of Stourbridge, in the Worcs. area. Hagley suffers about the same crime rate as others villages of a similar size, but the local police point out that their{detection rate}is above the national average. Being a fairly affluent area, Hagley attracts a large number of{house {burglaries.}Most offenders are from outside the village, but police are concerned at the increased vandalism in Hagley. Today, there are 2 to 3 policemen or women on foot around Hagley at any one time, with 2 or 3 fast response cars. The{station house}itself is manned at most times.
